Uses of Class
parallel.distributed.DAccumulatorSrv

  • Packages that use DAccumulatorSrv 
    Package Description
    parallel.distributed
    Extends the basic functionality found in the parallel package over many remote JVMs distributed over a network of machines.

    • Uses of DAccumulatorSrv in parallel.distributed

      Methods in parallel.distributed with parameters of type DAccumulatorSrv 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract void DAccMsg.execute(DAccumulatorSrv srv, java.io.ObjectOutputStream oos)
      if the object is a DAccNumber[s]Request, it instructs the server to add the data in its cache; else if it's a DGetMinRequest, it instructs the server to find the min value it holds and send it to the other end of the socket.
      void DAccNumberRequest.execute(DAccumulatorSrv srv, java.io.ObjectOutputStream oos)
      sends data field to the server.
      void DAccSerDblPairRequest.execute(DAccumulatorSrv srv, java.io.ObjectOutputStream oos)
      adds data fields to the server and sends back an OKReply.
      void DAccNumbersRequest.execute(DAccumulatorSrv srv, java.io.ObjectOutputStream oos)
      sends the data to the server for "accumulation".
      void DGetMinNumberRequest.execute(DAccumulatorSrv srv, java.io.ObjectOutputStream oos)
      calls the server's getMinValue() and writes it to the second argument that is the output stream of the socket to the client.
      void DGetArgMinObjectRequest.execute(DAccumulatorSrv srv, java.io.ObjectOutputStream oos)
      calls the server's getArgMin() and writes it to the 2nd argument that is the output stream of the socket to the client.
      void DGetMaxNumberRequest.execute(DAccumulatorSrv srv, java.io.ObjectOutputStream oos)
      calls the server's getMaxValue() method and writes it to the second argument that is the output stream of the socket to the client.
      void DGetArgMaxObjectRequest.execute(DAccumulatorSrv srv, java.io.ObjectOutputStream oos)
      calls the server's getArgMax() and writes it to the 2nd argument that is the output stream of the socket to the client.
      void DGetSumOfNumbersRequest.execute(DAccumulatorSrv srv, java.io.ObjectOutputStream oos)
      calls the server's getSumValue() method and writes it to the second argument that is the output stream of the socket to the client.
      void DShutDownSrvRequest.execute(DAccumulatorSrv srv, java.io.ObjectOutputStream oos)
      shuts-down the server.
